page.title: 01General:
page.content: Langwathby is on the western side of the Pennines.Edenhall is on the west side of the river. It is a beautiful area with wide views over the hills to the Lake District.The word "wath"means ford and this was a crossing place before there was a bridge.The river at Langwathby is fairly wide and shallow. It is noted for fishing.We can catch salmon,brown trout,sea-trout,eels and grayling.There are lots of river birds water-hens,herons,swans and ducks. We see the swifts and swallows diving for flies resting on the surface of the water.We sometimes see mink.There are not many holiday cottages in the villages which makes it easier for local people to stay here.There is a very special wind called the Helm.It is a strong gale blowing in from the Pennines.It has a dense,white cloud bar along the top of the Pennines.
